recap_documents.description: MEMORANDUM OPINION AND ORDER re: 268 MOTION for Reconsideration re; 266 Order, . MOTION to Vacate 266 Order, of Transferor Court Entered Absent Personal Jurisdiction. filed by Chetan Marfatia, 273 MOTION to Vacate 261 Utility - Miscellaneous, MOTION TO VACATE THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF CALIFORNIAS SEPTEMBER 26, 2019 RULING ON DEFENDANTS MOTION TO DISMISS. filed by AMBAC Assurance Corporation, 269 MOTION for Reconsideration . filed by Jefferies Mortgage Finance, Inc., Jefferies & Company Inc., Jefferies L.L.C., Jefferies Group LLC, 271 MOTION for Reconsideration re; 261 Utility - Miscellaneous, Reconsideration of the Northern District of California's September 26, 2019 Order on Defendants' Motion to Dismiss. filed by Danny Ray. For the reasons stated above, Defendants' motions for reconsideration are granted to the extent that (1) Plaintiffs' breach of fiduciary duty claims against Defendants Ambac and Marfatia are dismissed; (2) aiding and abetting breach of fiduciary duty claims premised on Defendants Ambac and Marfatia's breach of fiduciary duty are dismissed; and (3) Plaintiffs Sill Housing LLC and Lackland Family Housing LLC's RICO claims against Defendants Ambac and Marfatia are dismissed. Defendants' motions for reconsideration are otherwise denied. The Clerk of Court is directed to terminate the motions (Dkt. Nos. 268, 269, 271, 273). SO ORDERED. (Signed by Judge Paul G. Gardephe on 3/30/2021) (jca) (Entered: 03/31/2021)

caseName: BLACK v. JP MORGAN CHASE & CO

recap_documents.description: REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION re 36 MOTION to Dismiss re 1 Complaint filed by FICO, LLC, 32 MOTION to Dismiss re 1 Complaint filed by JP MORGAN CHASE & CO, BANK OF AMERICA CORPORATION, 42 MOTION to Dismiss re 1 Complaint filed by TRANSUNION, LLC, EXPERIAN INFORMATION SOLUTIONS, INC., EQUIFAX CREDIT INFORMATION SERVICES, INC., and 39 MOTION to Dismiss for Lack of Jurisdiction filed by VANTAGESCORE SOLUTIONS, LLC. It is respectfully recommended that the Motion of Defendants JP Morgan Chase & Co. and Bank of America Corporation to Dismiss the Complaint 32 be granted with prejudice. It is further recommended that the Motion of Defendant Fair Isaac Corporation to Dismiss the Complaint 36 be granted with prejudice. It is further recommended that the Motion of Defendant VantageScore Solutions LLC to Dismiss the Complaint 39 be granted with prejudice. It is further recommended that the Motion of Defendants Trans Union, Experian and Equifax to Dismiss the Complaint 42 be granted with prejudice. In addition, although not separately filed, Plaintiff requested leave to file an amended complaint in her opposition briefs to each of the above motions. It is respectfully recommended that those requests be denied. It is further recommended that Plaintiffs request for jurisdictional discovery, lodged in her opposition brief to VantageScore Solutions LLCs motion to dismiss, also be denied. Objections to R&R due by 8/29/2011. Signed by Chief Magistrate Judge Lisa Pupo Lenihan on 8/10/11. (clh) (Entered: 08/10/2011)
